edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll

Class CourseRoll

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.roll.CourseRoll

  • public class CourseRoll
extends java.lang.Object
    The CourseRoll class is responsible for handling the enrollment cap of each Course within the Course Catalog, as well as providing functionality for a student to enroll or drop a course from their schedule, based on the student's maximum credit hours and the Course's enrollment cap.
    Author:
    Steven Mayo

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CourseRoll(int capacity)
      Constructor for the CourseRoll object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean canEnroll(Student student)
      Checks to see if the specified Student can enroll into the current Course by checking if the number of available seats is at least 1 or greater.
      void drop(Student student)
      Removes a student from the current Course's course roll.
      void enroll(Student student)
      Attempts to enroll a student into the current Course by checking the Course's enrollment capacity and opening seating, as well as the Student's remaining Course hours.
      int getEnrollmentCap()
      Getter method that returns the current course's enrollment capacity.
      int getOpenSeats()
      Getter method that returns the number of open seat's for the current Course object.
      void setEnrollmentCap(int capacity)
      Sets the enrollment cap for the current Course object.

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • CourseRoll

        public CourseRoll(int capacity)
        Constructor for the CourseRoll object. An empty LinkedList is created with the provided capacity parameter.
        Parameters:
        capacity - Capacity of the LinkedList, which corresponds to the enrollmentCap of the Course object.

    • Method Detail

      • setEnrollmentCap

        public void setEnrollmentCap(int capacity)
        Sets the enrollment cap for the current Course object. If the specified capacity is outside of the minimum or maximum enrollment requirements, or the capacity is set below the number of currently enrolled students, then an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The enrollment cap for the provided Course object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - Thrown if the enrollment cap is set outside of the course's minimum or maximum enrollment limit, as well if the enrollment cap is set below the current number of enrolled students.

      • getEnrollmentCap

        public int getEnrollmentCap()
        Getter method that returns the current course's enrollment capacity.
        Returns:
        Enrollment cap of the current course.

      • getOpenSeats

        public int getOpenSeats()
        Getter method that returns the number of open seat's for the current Course object.
        Returns:
        The number of open seats available for the current Course.

      • enroll

        public void enroll(Student student)
        Attempts to enroll a student into the current Course by checking the Course's enrollment capacity and opening seating, as well as the Student's remaining Course hours.
        Parameters:
        student - The Student to enroll into the current Course.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Student to enroll is null or cannot enroll into the current Course. If an exception is encountered while attempting to add a Student to current CourseRoll, then it is propagated to the user.

      • drop

        public void drop(Student student)
        Removes a student from the current Course's course roll.
        Parameters:
        student - Student to remove from the current Course's course roll.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the student to remove is null or an Exception is thrown while attempting to remove the current Student from the CourseRoll object.

      • canEnroll

        public boolean canEnroll(Student student)
        Checks to see if the specified Student can enroll into the current Course by checking if the number of available seats is at least 1 or greater.
        Parameters:
        student - Student to enroll into the selected course.
        Returns:
        True if there is at least 1 seat left available for the student to occupy.
